How to Install freewheeling on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • freewheeling

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install freewheeling on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing freewheeling on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall freewheeling in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install freewheeling, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install freewheeling Using apt

To install freewheeling in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install freewheeling using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install freewheeling

The installation of freewheeling might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install freewheeling Using apt-get

To install freewheeling using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install freewheeling.

sudo apt-get -y install freewheeling

Install freewheeling Using Synaptic

To install freewheeling using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install freewheeling on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for freewheeling. This will display the freewheeling package in the package window, now to install freewheeling, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the freewheeling package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of freewheeling.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install freewheeling Using aptitude

To install freewheeling on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of freewheeling.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install freewheeling using the command aptitude install freewheeling.

sudo aptitude -y install freewheeling

How to Upgrade freewheeling on debian

If you want to upgrade the freewheeling package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade freewheeling using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade freewheeling to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade freewheeling.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade freewheeling sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade freewheeling

Upgrade freewheeling using Aptitude

To upgrade freewheeling using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade freewheeling.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade freewheeling

Upgrade freewheeling using Synaptic

To upgrade freewheeling using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for freewheeling, now right-click freewheeling, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade freewheeling just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall freewheeling on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall freewheeling from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just freewheeling, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove freewheeling

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of freewheeling

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of freewheeling you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge freewheeling

Remove freewheeling using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall freewheeling using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for freewheeling, right-click the freewheeling package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall freewheeling click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install freewheeling on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade freewheeling using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
